fields.summary: Cannot terminate instance in scaling group via "Manage Instances" dialog

fields.description:
The manage Instances widget allows you to select instances to be deleted. If you choose more than one and save your changes only 1 will be terminated.

Steps:
# create an auto scaling group and have it launch several instances
# in the ASG tab select the group and choose manage instances from the more actions button
# click red minus sign next to all instances
# select save changes
# only one instance will be terminated.
fields.summary: Manage instances widget cannot delete multiple instances

comments.body: Found this issue while verifying EUCA-7018
Thanks, I'll check it out.

Fixed and pushed to team/console/3.3.1

commit 02c48abbdc03f11d4c8e8eef9c4cb9dcbdd84f63
Author: Jerry Pommer <jpommer@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 24 17:00:21 2013 -0500

    EUCA-7058
    You can't walk a collection with _.each() if you're removing some items from it as you go.
please move to In QA and push team to testing
I repeated Tony's test: in Autoscaling Group -> Edit Instances I clicked the minus sign for all the instances then "Save" and only one instance was terminated.
Blocked by EUCA-7441

This has been a problem before, but it doesn't appear to be a console problem this time. The console is sending in a TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup request for each instance you choose to shut down, as expected, where before it would only send one.

The proxy is now returning a good result for the first request, and then rejects any subsequent requests with "400: Scaling activity in progress", as though the scaling group were locked or something while the first instance is being worked on. This is new backend behavior since the original fix for this bug. It used to handle this okay. Will consult with [~dkavanagh].
Recorded requests and responses shown in attachment.

Actually, I just went back to the API docs and found this:

Errors

ScalingActivityInProgress
You cannot delete an Auto Scaling group while there are scaling activities in progress for that group.

HTTP Status Code: 400

So, the backend behavior has changed, but now agrees with AWS. So I'll look for a way to defer subsequent termination requests or sit and wait awhile before retrying, or something.
Probably need a way to communicate that to the user too.

[~jpommer], the wireframe has a dialog for that situation already. Can you check for processes before displaying?

See https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Delete+scaling+group

[~neil] - This bug is about the manage instances dialog:
https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Instances?src=contextnavchildmode

But you're right, the delete instances dialog will have the same trouble. I'll dig in and see what our options are.

Gah, you're right! Sorry about that. I wonder why the CLC would complain about deleting the scaling group, when you are trying to delete instances? Is it that you cannot terminate instances that are not in a running state?
No, you just can't do more than one operation at a time. So we have to stage them and wait for the first to finish before terminating/deleting the next one.

Wait! I misread AWS docs... 

ScalingActivityInProgress
You cannot delete an Auto Scaling group while there are scaling activities in progress for that group.

Can't DELETE A SCALING GROUP... sorry, my mistake. But, we aren't trying to delete it. We're just scheduling the termination of instances within it. So, I think we're back to needing to hear from [~dkavanagh] on why we get that response. Doesn't look like we should.

Let's talk about what you're seeing. I was able to set 2 instance to 'unhealthy' and they were terminated and replaced.
I was then able to delete the autoscaling group (but only after I fixed a code error in deletescalinggroup.js where the collection name wasn't right. This is a regression and might have been getting in people's way. pushed that to testing directly.

David - if you hover on the right side of each row a delete button appears, like the tag editor controls. If you use those to "delete" a few instances, submitting the form will call "TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup" once for each instance you marked as deleted. First one to hit gets a 200 back, and the rest get the 400 response and the error shown in the attached text file. Good to know that you can still change the health status as before though, I hadn't rechecked that yet.

doMultiAjax was meant for exactly this kind of situation. I'm going to re-code to use that and see if it helps. It will report progress using a progress bar since there are potentially multiples here.
Pull request is here: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/37
Pushed to testing.

Fix Verified

All instances selected for termination are terminated

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.2734.20130917gitc33f19df.el6
